website_summaries.verdict: With just 4 parts to configure, this pot easily brews hot, flavorful coffee for a large group.
pros: May take up to 40 minutes to perk an entire urn of coffee, however will keep it warm for hours and even in chilly outdoor temperatures
Ideal for other hot beverages including cider and tea
Loved by large families as well
cons: Likely to get cold quickly if moved from its power source for travel purposes

website_summaries.verdict: A fast brewing coffee urn, it takes just one minute per cup to make the coffee.
pros: Interior markings indicate the correct water level for the number of cups you need to brew
It has an easy dispenser for single cup or continuous filling, and a bright indicator light
cons: The appearance is a little bit bland
This coffee urn is functional rather than aesthetically appealing

customer_reviews.title: Does not continue to keep contents heated after initial brewing.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly. As described, makes very good coffee. But let me point out the fact that it will not keep your coffee hot! Does not work like your typical coffee pot with the burner keeping that pot of coffee hot then shutting down automatically after 2 hours or so. My observation was that it heats up, brews the coffee then shuts off. So the coffee cools fairly quickly. For large groups it works well but if you have a group getting together for a full day you need to make a half pot and after a few hours make another half pot.This is not insulated. But it does work well and brews a good cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Really great for making hot chocolate!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that could quickly make hot chocolate for a large crowd and this coffee urn did the trick! Went to a bricks and mortar store and found a smaller one for the same price so it was actually a steal buying this on amazon. I’ve only used it to make hot chocolate so I can’t comment on its coffee making skills but it certainly makes some great hot chocolate and it didn’t burn it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Water leaks from spout
customer_reviews.text: The water slowly drips from the spout and when I came the next morning there was a puddle of water underneath it. Would not recommend this particular one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Barely worked
customer_reviews.text: I had this urn for years and never made a good brew of coffee. The results were always too weak no matter how much coffee grounds I used. In the last attempt I used used half the water and twice the grounds and got the worst result yet. Upon opening the top I realized 1/2 the grounds were still dry. I don't think its was always this bad but will never know. I finally just threw it out. Part of the problem might be there is no top water diffuser to equally distribute the water.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Appalled
customer_reviews.text: Received today and to my dismay very poor quality. First and foremost how does an electric coffee urn cord not come off for washing of pot 2) inside of pot was not only discolored it was out and out black. How is that possible on a supposed to be brand new item never used before
customer_reviews.author: patricia maloney

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2nd use at church
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for our church. After 2nd use the wiring on one of the units pulled lose at the base and shorted out. I see same compliant from other users. Reorderd a different brand. Hopefully the 2nd unit I originally purchased holds up better
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware it’s USED!! But advertising said NEW
customer_reviews.text: Just opened box to use for a Thanksgiving meal and the pot was filthy. Obviously used and Not even cleaned. Paid for a new item. This is gross and a rip off. Not even sure if it works.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this urn specifically to make hot water for Tea. I was so tired of people offering their "coffee run" at get togethers and the heated water comes out tasting slightly like coffee. So many people drink tea now. There is nothing worse than a cup of tea with a coffee after taste. This Urn works great. The water heats quickly and was a great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lee of Salem

customer_reviews.title: A good size
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived intact, packaged well. The price was right. We only used it once and I did not prep the coffee, the waitress did, but the coffee was good. We did have to unplug the pot to serve in a different location and it was almost all used, so I don't know how long the coffee stayed hot, sorry. Because of the price, brand name, I would recommend this product, however, I don't know about everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper girl

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT coffee pot for office use
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT coffee pot for office use! I had our school purchase an industrial coffee pot for almost $200 but the clear glass portion on the front had a seal that would leak all over the floor. I was desperate to find a coffee pot that would make a large number of cups and did NOT have that glass front. I bought this pot for a very cheap price but thought I would give it a try. It has worked PERFECTLY every single day and NO LEAKING areas from the spout! I may need to purchase another one if all 160 staff member start drinking coffee every day!
customer_reviews.author: vcraig

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and makes excellent coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried after reading the one-star reviews. Yet I really needed this for a school function and since I was buying it without reimbursement, I wasn't going to spend a penny more. I used Folger's silk coffee, filling it to the curved area of the filter. I'm a Starbucks kind of girl, and to tell the truth, this tasted almost as good. The unit is lightweight and easy to clean. It stains a little on the inside, but I don't think it harms the unit or interferes with any future use. Nice find!
customer_reviews.author: JennyCT

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for tea!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this foer an outdoor celebration tea. The object being to have tea. Well this does not actually boil water which means the tea is doesn't brew properly and is tepid. I would send it back if I hadn't used it. You really should not advertise that it can make hot water because what it makes is not hot!
customer_reviews.author: Michbean

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful, awful, awful. I have another Hamilton Beach urn that is fine. The first time that I used our new one a black stain formed on the inside that we couldn't get off. There were also small white deposits that clung to the interior of the urn. Since I used the urn to make coffee before I looked inside I don't know of any of the deposits came out with the water into my coffee cup. In addition, the cord was not detachable as described. I would return in in a flash but we're confined to our house because of the coronavirus.
customer_reviews.author: Stephe

customer_reviews.title: 45 cup takes 1 minute to brew per cup
customer_reviews.text: I like that there was a information booklet which told me the amount of coffee grounds to use when making the coffee--nice touch. However, there is one negative: there is no on and off switch. When you plug the cord in the socket, the pot is turned on and stays on and the pot does get hot. This is probably so because it is cheaper to make this way. It does make a tasty cup of coffee which is important.
customer_reviews.author: bsnbsn

customer_reviews.title: Great large urn. Stays v hot.
customer_reviews.text: Great urn. I have an electric one that I usually use. This urn is much bigger, holds a lot more water and stays much hotter. I really like it. The only disadvantage to this urn compared to my other one is the safety feature. This urn can be easy for children to dispense on their own and possibly burn themselves, whereas my electric urn has buttons on the top that children can’t reach and it has a lock feature. However, if no young children around this is a great buy
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical for group meetings
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The product box was a bit crushed and the brushed aluminum was scraped up, but I got it for a group who have regular meeting and this fits the bill perfectly. Nice size for cleanup. It actually makes the coffee pretty quickly. Everyone is happy with it. Especially me when I go to grab a cup of coffee and there's still some left, because it's big enough.
customer_reviews.author: R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Dont purchase this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: The stem is very short and the water never was able to rise and brew the coffee. The stem did not sit firmly in the bottom. We tried several times at the party and never had coffee. Very disappointing for a really simple item..
customer_reviews.author: carole lee

customer_reviews.title: Party Coffee carafe
customer_reviews.text: Good item. But I wish that it does not have an auto off feature after it brews. Coffee gets cold quickly. After 20 mins coffee was tepid. Not good. I say if plugged. Coffee should be hot.
customer_reviews.author: Noemi Barrero

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one of these and both work fine. It is not a super solid feeling product but is excellent for the price. I don't know how it would hold up for daily use but for occasional use at parties it is excellent. It makes good coffee, keeps the water hot, and doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: B.K.

customer_reviews.title: Metal outside is hot enough to burn you
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee pot. At work i would make 10 plus pots a day. Now i make this 45 cups once and thats it. So happy i made this purchase. Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Use a regular drip coffee filter!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for Thanskgiving dinner. It worked great as long as you follow a few simple rules and adjustments. 1. I followed the guidelines for the # of cups of coffee grounds in the manual. It was spot on! The minor adjustment at the suggestion of mu son, was to use a standard drip coffee filter as a filter for the maker. The holes are rather large and even with a course grind, it was falling into the water. I cut a small square in the coffee filter than spread it on the bottom of the percolator coffee holder. No grounds in the coffee! It was easy fix. Everyone loved the coffee! Highly recommended if you make the adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: chimyfolkbutter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Coffee pot stopped working after using it 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Coffee pot stopped working after using it 3 times and cannot return it. It's not like you would use this size pot many times in a month (the return time) to see if it's working good!!! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Koch

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my crew at work, they go through a LOT of coffee, and had to replace a similar coffee maker to this very one. They make coffee 5-6 days a week all year long, and the former coffee maker lasted nearly 10 years, if we can get that much use out of this one, I would be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great insulation, delicious coffee
customer_reviews.text: This percolator is so easy to use and makes great coffee. I was pleasantly surprised that it keeps the coffee warm for the duration of any event I’ve used it for, up to three hours, even though the description says it does not keep the coffee warm intentionally the insulation is good enough but it maintained its heat throughout my three hour event, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Taylor Peck

customer_reviews.title: HOT water!!  EASY to use, reliable, love this!
customer_reviews.text: With one caveat, it is very hot to the touch..so if you have small children or pets be aware of this..Otherwise super happy with this, kep water and coffee very hot..Easy to use, 45 cups was certainly appreciated in our crowd! Much cheaper than urns on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Cnmn

customer_reviews.title: Best money I ever spent!  Thank God for Amazon prime!
customer_reviews.text: After searching at Walmart, Target and Bed, Bath and Beyond, I decided to love on Amazon. I couldn't find a coffee urn ANYWHERE! But voila - with one click on my smart phone, I found this on Amazon, ordered it and had in in 2 days! Awesome! Great price and great product! Love this coffee urn! Honestly I haven't made coffee in it, but used it for hot drinks at Christmas party. It heats up very fast!!!!! Be careful because the sides get quite hot. I don't know how I lived without one of these before! Everyone should have one!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wetzell

customer_reviews.title: Great for meetings
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for use at an office when we have larger gatherings once a month. We have been using is for almost a year. Easy to clean as long as you clean it well after every use, don't let it build up.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Cat Owner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Keeps Beverages Very Hot!!
customer_reviews.text: At first glance I was worried that these pots (I bought 2) would cool off and not keep beverages warm. Boy was I ever wrong!! We actually had to unplug one of the pots to cool down the beverage a little. They worked great and were easy to use and to clean up!!! I'm so glad I bought them. I will be using them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Holly C.

customer_reviews.title: One pot is all you need!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Can make one pot of coffee to last my rommate and I all day. Extremely easy to set up, clean and dispense from. Quick brew time for 42 cups of coffee, about as long as your standard coffee pot. Cons: The outside of this thing gets hot, very hot, do not recommend using with kids around. Lid twists on and stays there, but it would have been nice if it for a little more tightly. No sight gauge to let you know how much coffee is left inside. I use this when my friends and I hangout together and are planning on being up all night. Thus so far I have been completely satisfied. This thing does work!
customer_reviews.author: C.R. Crews

customer_reviews.title: Cord is not detachable.
customer_reviews.text: The urn does what it's suppose to. Coffee doesn't scorch. Description states cord is detachable.....it most definitely is not, That was the biggest selling point to me. What a let down. But, on the high side, it made great coffee. It held the coffee nicely for our gathering without it getting bitter.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made coffee in Iraq for 176 soldiers a day for 9 months with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Reddogglife

customer_reviews.title: Very large coffee Hot Water brewer
customer_reviews.text: I love this Coffee pot, it is great for parties and events. The reason I did not give it 5 stars, is because the inside stains and gets corroded terribly each time when I empty the remaining water out after brewing. I think it is because the body of the pot is of aluminum, I thought it was stainless, it is a bit concerning to me. I scrub it out but the stains stay. It does keep water/ coffee very hot, which is good, but I am on the beach of another high capacity pot of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Oberon

customer_reviews.title: Quality Coffee / Hot Water Urn
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to make hot water and coffee for some of our social functions. My wife found this Hamilton Beach 42-Cup Coffee Urn to replace our old one which lasted over a decade. After ten years it seems the quality is still up there. Happy with our purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: William Struse

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot, stays hot
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for us. Holds up to 45 cups of water at a time. Takes a little while to heat for all those cups and when it us heating it makes a loud noise but it's not so bad. And once it gets hot, it stays HOT. Almost boiling. Great item and great price. We have actually had ours for a while now (about 5 months) and we are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Snakeskin Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great little percolator
customer_reviews.text: Worked great during a recent 30 day work trip. We used this probably 20 hours a day for 30 days straight and had no issues with it. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star review is I think it could really benefit from having an on/off switch of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Denesowicz

customer_reviews.title: Water doesn't boil, and inside becomes nasty
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 different ones (Thank's to Amazon for excellent customer service!), they both never boil. Although it does keep water hot, it should at least boil once for health reasons not just heat it up. The insides after a few uses gets nasty and black, and peels. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Yitz the Maven

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical at first but love it now.
customer_reviews.text: We make a lot of chai for our gatherings. First I thought this was a thermos type and was skeptical. But when we tried a couple time, actually the heating function makes it even better. Easy to clean as well because the big opening on top.
customer_reviews.author: SAMIRK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people who like more than one cup of coffee per day with family and friends.
customer_reviews.text: I use this 45 cup coffee urn for when family and friends stop by. I have a single serve coffee maker but it is not for when coffee drinkers are over. What is nice about the coffee urn is that I can make as many or as few cups as I want. It is easy to clean - no filter is needed. Just the right size and right price. Takes very little counter space - you can keep it out or put it away easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Good Cup!
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee pot. It is not heavy stainless like a pot we replaced. But it brews quickly and makes a good cup of coffee. It is easy to fill and clean. Great pot for the price. I donated this to our school for coffee for the teachers' meetings.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineSherryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My family come to visit me and they don’t turn on electricity on Saturday, I purchased this urn and it is used by them for hot drinks. It’s also good for the holidays that host a lot of guests, Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coffee Urn  Cord stays attached
customer_reviews.text: Nice coffee urn. Handles are not as sturdy as I would like. Cord stays attached, so no worry of losing it, but I worry about putting it in the sink to clean it. Keeps coffee very hot and makes a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Boy

customer_reviews.title: Stays really hot
customer_reviews.text: For the money these were a great addition to our office kitchen. We used them to provide hot apple cider for an event and they worked great. They heated quickly and were easy to clean. My only complaint is that they stay really hot and they stay on as long as they are plugged in. There is no temperature adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: jpc1973

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed After only a few months this product seems defected There is water coming out of the sides sometimes and since the spout is very low and doesn’t fit over even a standard mug I have to tip the whole water heater and more water spills out from the sides It also seems that the water is burning on the inside and causing the heater to rot. It is fairly new and I did not expect it to be poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Ruti horn

customer_reviews.title: Stands up under daily use.
customer_reviews.text: I manage a boarding house. I like the size and affordable price. I use it as a hot pot. It is in operation 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Rod K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cup Of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Used perfectly. After I read the reviews of ppl not having it easy I still selected this product & it was perfect for me. It is important to note I use a french press daily & this coffee machine I thought would make coffee good enough for company but it was great for me too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Haapapuro

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee urn in March 2018 and here we are in January 2019 and it's dead. We had another brand before this one and that one lasted us at least 3 years. This one didn't even make it to 1 full year. Our office has 25 employees that use the coffee urn each week day. I'm extremely disappointed that is would stop working so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mascarenas

customer_reviews.title: Best quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for all the guys at work to have coffee. They love this coffee maker so much they have purchased this coffee maker themselves! Great quality product for a reasonable price I'll definitely buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Kendra B.

customer_reviews.title: The water comes out tasting like metal
customer_reviews.text: I used it the first time, excited to have instant hot water, however, I had to toss my drink, the water tastes like metal. I thought I could return it like all other amazon prime orders. However, amazon only told me to contact hamilton beach for warranty help and it has been months and I cannot reach a representative, they pass me around and nobody has been able to assist me. Very strange customer service, I wish I could return it since it takes up space in my small apartment and is not usable. would not reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: MES

customer_reviews.title: Great pot!
customer_reviews.text: This pot works great. I will tell you, however, that it does take about 1 min per cup. So, if you need the full amount of 42 cups, be prepared to wait for it. The percolator is a bit noisy at times, too, if that makes a difference for you. I like the way the coffee tastes after it is made, very "natural" tasting. There were some grounds that escaped, but with any percolator you will get the same few grounds that end up in the last cup of coffee you pour out of the pot. If you need a portable, manageable pot that can brew up to 42 cups, I think you will like this one just fine!
customer_reviews.author: chubbycherub

customer_reviews.title: it is light weight and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: this product is very user friendly. it took a while for the coffee to finish brewing. but that is to be expected when you are brewing 42 cups. it is light weight and easy to clean. no complaints. as a matter of fact I was only going to give this product 4 stars but then I started writing about it and I realized that my experiences with it are worthy of the 5th star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for good tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we were tired of making pot after pot when we got brunch, which is pretty frequently. The coffee tasted great, even after being kept hot for a few hours. And it was very easy to use. It's bulky, of course, but super light.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I made hot chocolate in mine for a hot chocolate bar. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee urn out there!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my father's bridge parties! Takes between 45 minutes- an hour to brew coffee but it does exactly what's it's supposed to exactly as advertised! Would definitely recommend :).
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy For the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I used this coffee urn at a breakfast function. It worked perfectly. I brewed the coffee at home and transported the full urn. I did follow the instructions in the manual and removed the container that holds the grounds. I put it in a box in the front seat of my car, and it arrived with no spillage. As long as you keep in mind that it is hot and full when carrying it, there should not be any major issues. For the price, this was a great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Diane E. Stinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy and makes lots
customer_reviews.text: No filters required. I love these so much I have purchased 2. One for work and one for my friends AA group. Both have worked great. Easy to clean and easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hukalo

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Goods
customer_reviews.text: Received the product with a large dent in it. Will keep it and use it because we need it. Love paying full price for a damaged product... Thank you, may I have another?
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: It's ookay.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, and only used for two days. One of them didn't come with the silver stick to actually percolate. Luckily the other did. But one isn't perculating anymore. It does keep warm and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: For your information
customer_reviews.text: The coffee pot is used in our church kitchen at least every Sunday. It cooks coffee and keeps it hot. A couple of things that our ladies complain about is they do not like the permanently attached cord when it gets in the way to clean the pot. Second, after the first brew the inside of the pot was stained and could not be restored to new looking. On the inside it is clean but the brown stain makes it still look dirty.
customer_reviews.author: His Kingdom

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a big coffee pot for his work because, the one there was too small and, required them to make multiple pots a night. This one is perfect. The coffee gets brewed up, stays fresh, stays warm and, serves multiple people. The price is pretty fantastic, as well! An excellent product choice if anyone is in the market for a percolator (or coffee urn, in this case).
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: We were worried when we first opened the box because the quality looked kind of cheap. But we made a giant pot of coffee for our customers. It came out delicious. One thing to keep in mind is it takes about a minute per cup to brew so if you are doing the full 42 cups start it 45 minutes ahead of time. We enjoyed the temperature of the coffee. You could take a sip right away without burning your tongue.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: May be I looked at the pictures and deceived, Its poorly made. During the first use, there is internal black deposit in the inside metal, when we boiled water without the filter. I think the dye came from plastic lid, which gives the indication that the materials are inferior quality
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Iyyadurai

customer_reviews.title: Great for coffee & hot choc.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice for coffee and hot choc. Arrived quickly
customer_reviews.author: Robin Martin Hill

customer_reviews.title: This Coffee Urn is fantastic. I don't really make coffee in it because ...
customer_reviews.text: This Coffee Urn is fantastic. I don't really make coffee in it because I don't want my tea to taste like coffee so I just make hot water and then tea or instant coffee but it's quite useful and definitely beats having to boil water myself every time I want a hot drink. Greatly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Not stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: This unit is billed as a stainless steel unit but the inside is aluminum which is not good as it interacts with the coffee to impart a bad taste and is hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: LT8282

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this coffee urn! It heats up the liquid quickly, looks nice at parties, and doesn't drip. Even though I haven't used it for many types of liquids yet, I plan on using it for coffee, tea, cider, hot chocolate, and more!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica F.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome party pot!
customer_reviews.text: Heats up a huge amount a liquid super fast. Easy to use. Does a good job. It does seem to stain/tarnish on the inside a little so I use a steel wool to get it clean.
customer_reviews.author: AppKate

customer_reviews.title: HB 45 Cup Coffee Urn
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for church use for a replacement of another urn. Very happy with the looks and how it keeps the water very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste C. Gettings

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well over time.
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our church coffee station. The only drawback is that the heating element of the pot gets black pretty quickly. We actually had an older version of this for years and thought the element was corroding, so we bought this new one. It got as black as the old one in one use... lol. Oh well. Now we have two...
customer_reviews.author: jk2john

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these urns, one for hot spiced cider and the other for coffee and both turned out delicious. It makes it so much easier to serve when you are entertaining a lot of people. It was very easy to set up and all you need to do is plug it in and in a few minutes you have a hot beverage.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Sepe

customer_reviews.title: Wonderul
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our lady's tea at church. I can make enough hot water in this to accommodate the crowd. I have not brewed coffee in it, but it heats up fast and percolates through very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nokat2

customer_reviews.title: No shut off switch
customer_reviews.text: No on-off switch so you must unplug it every time you're done with it. I would not recommend buying this. This should have been a $19.99 item.
customer_reviews.author: Outlaw Will

customer_reviews.title: Well priced and well made
customer_reviews.text: I buy this item every few years... it is well priced and lasts for a few years at a time. When water starts to taste bad I replace it
customer_reviews.author: Biggest fan

customer_reviews.title: Good urn but metal coating inside scraped off - had to return
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a great urn... but the metal coating inside scraped off after a few uses and exposed the surface underneath. We had to return. Aside from that (and maybe we got a defective one...?) it worked quite well.
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline bocian

customer_reviews.title: Great urn for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: My building's tenant's association needed a new coffee urn and none of the stores nearby had one at that price. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Traina

customer_reviews.title: Heats quick, stays hot
customer_reviews.text: I love this dispenser! I usually make coffee in it, but I have also kept mulled wine in it as well. Whatever is placed in there stays hot for HOURS. This is a great addition to any family or work function!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee guy don't get high. Excellent product. Brews 1 8oz cup a minute. You do the math. Perfect for meetings/gatherings where coffee is an implied demand.
customer_reviews.author: Meon

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do. I use it to keep 45 cups of tea warm and ready. I have never used for coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Rene 1

customer_reviews.title: NO DETACHABLE CORD!!
customer_reviews.text: The product description is INCORRECT in that it states "a detachable cord for easy storage". The "Hamilton Beach 40515 - 42 Cup Coffee Urn, Silver" product that I received DOES NOT have a detachable cord. The cord is permanently attached which is a hassle with cleaning and storing this larger sized coffee urn.
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Took forever to make coffee. Timed it at different cup levels and was way longer that the estimated time. Could just be this one that did it or something. Works good to heat water for tea though.
customer_reviews.author: BigMigz

customer_reviews.title: Safe and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I needed these for school games and activities and they worked out great! I ordered two of this exact product and both worked well and were easy to use. Included instructions and really brought school spirit to our soccer and basketball games especially since it was cold outside ! Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Cheap; does as advertised
customer_reviews.text: not crazy that there is no power indicator light but otherwise gets the job done- aka keep hot water hot for many hours. be careful of handling the urn- only move it around using the handles as the rest of the urn can get pretty hot.
customer_reviews.author: Hennie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my choir to supplement the other two pots that they have. It is by far the best of the three coffee pots! No dripping on the tablecloth, easy to make and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Lefton

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing the high reviews and the "#1 purchase" logo in Amazon. It was affordable. Can make from 10 to 42 cups. I don't think I'll order this again. Everything is made with poor quality materials. Super light. No power button. Inside parts are plastic! which I did not like. We will use it until it lasts and order a better quality product the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this item. It takes a little bit to brew or heat up water but heating up the 45 cups is very effective. Even if you unplug and leave out for people to enjoy, the water/ coffee stays hot.
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Amori

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible.. I bought this for a gender reveal for a hot chocolate bar and it scorched the milk and ruined the urn.. It has to be thrown away.. A waste of money I’m so disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Lehmberg

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a hot drink party I was throwing, and it was easy to use and worked great! I've since used it to make coffee and also pulled out the filter piece and used it to keep other drinks (hot chocolate, cider, etc) warm. You have to really clean it well, especially around the nozzle, but I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Janell Simmons

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: The tube in the middle has to fit perfectly or it doesn’t heat. Very aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: tammy hall

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this coffee maker and have used it 1 time. It works great, make coffee quickly and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: BIG & HOT!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my staff of 18. Only caveat is that the exterior gets REALLY hot. Like burn your palm hot. You also need to grind your coffee with larger grinds so that it does not fall through the interior metal filter. We could not find paper ones to go on top, so we assume you are supposed to use the metal one inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and for the most part does the job
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that you can refill the urn from the half-way point with cold water and the thermostat won't trigger it to reheat.
customer_reviews.author: Ari G.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Worked amazing at our baby shower with 100 guests. Coffee was ready in 30min, great flavor and hot
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Everyone at the bridal party was happy with the coffee so the directions we're correct on the amount of coffee and water.
customer_reviews.author: Jump Roper

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Coffee Urn
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and simple. I bought for my classroom and it works well. It's a little noisy like a coffeemaker and you should started 20 minutes before you need it. We use it to heat water. Heats up to 42 cups of water and it keeps it hot for the two to four hours that we use it. Cord is short so you'll need a small appliance extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: this works great and keeps coffee very warm
customer_reviews.text: this works great and keeps coffee very warm, the only draw back is the metal can get really hot not alot of insulation
customer_reviews.author: j starlinf

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this run for the Westfield Baha'i community in MA. They are quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A. Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Good for Army use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 100+ Soldier Army unit and we use it when we go to the field. It works as advertised, makes about a cup a minute. My one complaint is that it doesn't shut off when coffee gets too hot but for the price it absolutely works well and keeps my Soldiers caffeinated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my classroom and it's nearly perfect! I only wish it had an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Zarrin reynolds

customer_reviews.title: This is a good item to have for our family since we can ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good item to have for our family since we can have an open coffee corner all day long since we have many visitors. In the past this brand has not lasted more than a year but it’s a good price and worth replacing annually
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this for a wedding and missed the return window. When we set it up the day before, we found that the pot was broken and the inside metal rod that held the pieces together was bent. This made it impossible to close the lid tightly. We tried to run water through to see if it worked but it dangerously sprayed. Find a different product if you want a reliable coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky English

customer_reviews.title: You want one of these! Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We actually got two for a wedding reception Hocho bar and they were perfect. We now use one around the home and it works great! Always ready fir a hot beverage!
customer_reviews.author: Chadmichelle Poulsen

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 45 Cup Coffee Urn and Hot Beverage Dispenser, Silver
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Single-SpoutMakes 15-45 cups. Cup-per-minute brewing speed. Water-level indicators. Ready-to-serve light. Easy to fill. 2-way dispenser. Twist-lock lid and large handles. Removable cord. Glossy aluminum finish. Comfortable handles. Easy to clean and store. Dishwasher safe twist-lock lid and brew basket. When brewing makes 30 to 45 cups.

AMAZON.COM
Ideal for buffet-style entertaining at home or as a self-serve option at a large business meeting, this coffee urn brews and holds between 15 and 45 cups of coffee. Designed to serve crowds, the polished aluminum urn brews about a cup of coffee per minute and has a ready-to-serve light that lets you know when you can start pouring. The two-way dispenser depresses to fill a single cup or can be propped in the vertical position to fill a larger carafe. Water level markings inside the urn help you accurately fill the urn to the proper water level. For safety, this coffee urn has heat-resistant handles and a locking lid for easier carrying without spillage. Other convenient features include a dishwasher-safe lid and brew basket and a detachable cord for easy storage. Hamilton Beach provides a 2-year limited warranty on this appliance. --Cristina Vaamonde
feature_bullets: Fast brewing, takes just 1 minute to brew each cup
Brews enough for a crowd: makes 15 to 45 cups of hot, fresh Coffee, perfect for social gatherings and buffet style meals
2 Way dispenser for single cup or continuous filling
Easy to fill: water level markings in the urn’s interior make measuring water a snap

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,230 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
